articles.title: Meetings to remember Kim  Il Sung
articles.content:
Kim  Il Sung praised
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Taheza, national vice-chairman of the Militant Action Party for Sovereignty of Madagascar, recently issued a statement titled "Korean people hold his excellency Kim  Il Sung in high esteem as eternal President" on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the President Kim  Il Sung's passing away.   President Kim  Il Sung liberated the country by organizing and leading the 20-year-long arduous anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to victory, demonstrated the spirit of heroic Korea by leading the Fatherland Liberation War against the invasion of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to victory and built a powerful socialist state, the statement said, and went on:   The Korean people are upholding and following him as their eternal President though he passed away.   His history as a peerlessly great man, veteran politician and great military strategist is now being creditably carried forward by the leader Kim  Jong Il.

articles.title: Great revolutionary life
articles.content:
Meetings to remember Kim  Il Sung
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Meetings of Koreans in Russia and China were held in Moscow and Beijing on July 1 and 4 respectively to remember the noble life and revolutionary exploits of the President Kim  Il Sung on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his passing away.   At the meetings, reporters and speakers referred to the immortal exploits performed by the President for the Korean revolution and the world revolution and his love and solicitude for overseas compatriots.   They expressed their firm determination to actively contribute to the struggle for the country's reunification and the building of a powerful socialist state under the wise leadership of the respected Marshal Kim  Jong Il true to the last wishes of the President.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities accused of misuse of songs
Release of "NADR" delegation members urged
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities accused of misuse of songs
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- It has been brought to light that songs which belong to the period of enlightenment, created and sung by North Korean writers, composers and vocalists, are distorted and abused in South Korea.   In this connection the central committee of the Korean Musicians Union released a statement Monday, which said:   Over 1,000 songs created by northerners have been misused in South Korea.
   This is attributable to the South Korean authorities' anti-national policy of hostility towards the north and their moves to obliterate the national culture.
In the name of the entire nation, the KMU central committee bitterly denounces the misuse of songs as unprecedentedly vicious and shameless distortion of history.
   Recalling that the successive rulers of South Korea have overlooked and fostered the misuse of songs created by northerners during the period of enlightenment, the statement branded them as a group of traitors to the nation, who defined the fellow countrymen as "enemy" and trampled down the precious heritage of national culture.

articles.title: Foreign embassy officials visit Panmunjom
Joint resolution of preparatory committees
articles.content:
Foreign embassy officials visit Panmunjom 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of Culture and Friendly Relations of Foreign Embassies in Korea visited Panmunjom on Monday on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the President Kim  Il Sung's passing away.   The visitors laid bouquets before President Kim  Il Sung's autographed dedication built in front of the Thongil House and paid respects to him.   They were briefed on the autographed dedication.   Then they went round different places of Panmunjom such as the conference hall of the armistice talks, the hall where the armistice agreement was signed and the conference room of the former military armistice commission and saw the concrete wall built in the area south of the Military Demarcation Line by  the U.S. imperialists and the South Korean authorities.

articles.title: Meeting of north preparatory committee
Functions on 5th anniversary of Kim  Il Sung's passing away
Japanese government's move to incite militarism assailed
Cambodian King's visit to Korea welcomed
articles.content:
Japanese government's move to incite militarism assailed
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a signed commentary today lashes out at the Japanese government for issuing an instruction on including "Hinomaru" and "Kimigayo" in the textbooks to be introduced in the next school year and instilling them into the Japanese schoolchildren. Underlying the instruction is the Japanese government's attempt to imbue its people with militarism, the commentary observes, and continues:   It is not difficult to guess what road the schoolchildren will take in future, after receiving education intended to justify Japan's past crimes, worshipping "Hinomaru" and singing "Kimigayo".   
   Japan is now rushing headlong toward reinvasion of Asia.
   The DPRK is considered to be the first target of Japan's overseas aggression.
   All its military moves are targeted  against it.
   Anti-DPRK sentiments are systematically fostered in Japan.
   The groundless smear campaign launched by  the Japanese reactionaries  against the DPRK is intended to justify their moves for reinvasion and find an excuse for it. 
   This makes us follow the Japanese authorities' moves with  a high degree of vigilance.

articles.title: U.S. move to build "Korean War memorial"
Kim  Il Sung remembered by Chinese crewmen
articles.content:
U.S. move to build "Korean War memorial"
   Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The United States is scheming to build "Korean War memorial" in  the suburbs of Chicago.   The U.S. plans to finish the plottage project of the memorial this year, commence its project and complete it by 2003, 50 years after the cease-fire in Korea.   The memorial to be called the "Korean War participants memorial state museum-cum-library" is aimed at beautifying the crimes  committed by the U.S. imperialists in the past.

articles.title: All unconverted long-term prisoners should be repatriated
articles.content:
Kim  Il Sung remembered by Chinese crewmen
   Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Crewmen of the Chinese ships "An Kang" and "Hai Huo Leng-5" on Monday met at the Wonsan port on the east coast of Korea to remember the President Kim  Il Sung with the approach of the 5th anniversary of his passing away.
   The reporter and speakers at the meeting said that the President founded the unique Juche idea, led the anti-Japanese revolutionary war to victory and brought the joy of the country's liberation to the Korean people and beat back the armed invasion by the U.S. imperialists and their satellites to defend the security of the country. 
   He is, indeed, an invincible and iron-willed commander, they stressed, and went on:   The Korean people lost the greatest man, but they know no pessimism because they are led by the Kim  Jong Il who is identical with the President in idea, leadership and traits.   A letter to Kim  Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.
   The participants laid a floral basket before the President's statue in Wonsan.

articles.title: Undying feats made for national reunification
Cambodian King here
Greetings to Malawian President
articles.content:
Cambodian King here 
   Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihanouk arrived here this afternoon for an official goodwill visit to Korea at the invitation of Kim  Yong Nam President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.   Many Pyongyangites were seen at the airport to warmly welcome the friendly envoy of Cambodia.   The King was met at the airport by president Kim  Yong Nam, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys in Pyongyang.   A ceremony for welcoming the King was held at the airport.

articles.title: Chonsam-ri, land of bliss
articles.content:
Greetings to Malawian President
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim  Yong Nam President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK,  sent a message of greetings to Malawian President Bakili Muluzi Monday on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the independence of Malawi and the 33rd anniversary of the proclamation of the republic.   The message wished the Malawian President and people great success in their work for peace and prosperity of the country and expressed conviction that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue developing on good terms.

articles.title: National seminar held to mark  Kim  Il Sung's passing away
Meeting  held in Panmunjom
Yang Hyong Sop meets director general of IIJI
Floral basket laid before Kim  Il Sung's statue
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets director general of IIJI
   Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Society, met and had a talk with Shuhachi Inoue, director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.   The director general said that the President Kim  Il Sung was the greatest of the great men in the 20th century whom no one  could match in idea, leadership and personality. Reverence for the President has grown stronger among the world progressives over the past five years since his passing away, he noted, adding:   It is a great pride and honor not only for the Korean people but also for the world progressives to hold Kim  Il Sung  in high esteem as the eternal sun of humankind.

articles.title: Floral basket laid before Kim  Il Sung's statue by diplomatic corps
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Kim  Il Sung's statue
   Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A floral basket came from Yasser Arafat,  President of the State of Palestine, on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the passing away of the President Kim  Il Sung.   Palestinian ambassador to Korea Shaher Mohammed Abdlah and embassy officials laid a floral basket before the President's statue on Mansu Hill today and paid homage to him.   Written on the ribbon hanging from the basket were letters "H.E. the great leader Kim  Il Sung will be immortal".
